history.content: IMO CS170 is essential, and you should take it ASAP. I don't think it's too similar to CS 70 - I'd even think of it as the algorithms (and some data structures) parts of CS 61B with CS 70-style proofs.

children.subject: I really struggled with 70 as well, but I'm in 170 right now and I find it a lot different and am really enjoying it. I agree with the student answer, it's a lot more similar to 61B imo.

I'm gonna play devil's advocate and say 170 itself isn't essential for getting a job in SWE as long as you know certain programming concepts really well from external practice (think interview prep. like CTCI, leetcode, hackerrank etc.) Some of these concepts include greedy algorithms, dynamic programming, miscellaneous topics like quick select / union find and being really familiar with graph algorithms like BFS/DFS/Dijkstra's since these pop up a lot in interviews. If you can get these concepts down by simply grinding a lot of coding problems, you're not going to really need to know about topics like FFT, NP-completeness and LP imo and could get away without taking 170 necessarily. 

However, you could take 170 P/NP to supplement your own interview prep (without risk of sabotaging your GPA or mental health), and if you're not too keen on prepping on your own, then you should definitely take 170. Do take note that 170 cannot directly substitute SWE interview prep, unless you're one of those people that can implement a concept in actual code after reading about it once.
I struggled a lot in 70 and in very different ways in 170, and definitely feel like it was worth taking. I put it off until fall of senior year, but think that was perfectly fine for me.

history.content:
So I'm a rising junior, but I managed to get pretty much all my lower division classes and prerequisites out of the way, and I have enough units to graduate by Spring next year, which is what I'm planning. So, I've taken all my lower divs, and I'm taking 188 at the moment. I am planning on taking CS 162 this summer, and for fall I was planning 168 and 186/161. The thing is, I was debating between taking 164 or 170 for my last class, because I know that 170 is important knowledge for getting a job and all that, but I struggled really hard with 70, and I know that 170 is going to be a lot worse, so I'm debating whether it's worth it to wait until my last semester and then take 170 pass/no pass after I've gotten all my upper division requirements taken care of. Any advice would be wonderful. 

For reference, I want to take 161, 164/160, 186, 168, data 100, 170 and maybe 169 if it's offered, in the next two semesters. Any advice about that would also be very helpful, thank you.
history.subject: Deciding when to take 170
